name: Nightmare Haunt

traits.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nightmare haunt has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Somnophage
entries: At the start of its turn, the nightmare haunt gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 5 times the number of {@condition unconscious} creatures within 30 feet of itself.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The nightmare haunt makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
entries: Melee atk +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3 damage) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8 damage) psychic damage.

actions.name: Tendrils of Slumber {@recharge 5}
entries: The nightmare haunt creates spectral tendrils that cover the ground in a 20-foot square that it can see within 30 feet of itself for 1 minute or until it uses this action again. When a creature other than the nightmare haunt enters the affected area for the first time or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take 11 (2d10 damage) necrotic damage and have the {@condition restrained} condition. The affected ground is also considered difficult terrain for creatures other than the nightmare haunt for the duration of its effect.

A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tendrils must repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition unconscious} condition and instead of the {@condition restrained} condition caused by the tendrils. On a successful save, the effect ends on the creature. An {@condition unconscious} creature remains asleep until it is no longer in the area with tendrils, takes any damage, or is targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

senses: blindsight 120 ft. (can't see beyond this radius)
